Note.Content: MT HOTTP-B NJPS NRSV ESV "heaves" NIV "trembles" GNT "shakes" CEV "shudder" | RSV "is laid waste" NJB "collapses" = {L:וַתִּשָּׁא<SDBH:שׁאה>} | REB "is in tumult"
RSV NIV NJPS NJB NRSV REB GNT CEV | LXX ἀντιτασσόμενος ἀντιτάξομαι αὐτοῖς = {L:שָׂנֹא אֶשְׂנָא<SDBH:שׂנא>}
NJPS CEV | RSV NIV NJB NRSV REB GNT "forget"
MT HOTTP-B RSV NRSV "... hands" NIV | NJB GNT CEV "... waves"

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: = process by which an object increases in height
= process by which objects rise up from a certain location
= causative action by which humans or forces take hold of objects and cause them to rise up from a certain location
literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans or animals lift up part of their body, such as hands, palms, wings
literally: to lift up (one's heart or self) towards something or someone; hence: = action by which humans turn to a deity or location with the confidence that they will find help and support there
literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans take hold of objects with their hands, with the intention of holding them or bringing them to another location
= state in which humans, animals, or objects are bearing a load while moving from one place to another
literally: to take a wife (for oneself); hence: = action by which a man contracts a marriage with a woman for himself
literally: to take a wife (for someone else); hence: = action by which a man contracts a marriage with a woman on behalf of someone else

Glosses.Gloss: to take a wife (for someone else)

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to hold; hence: = process by which humans are held responsible for a certain action or for the well-being of others
literally: to cause to hold; hence: = causative process by which humans cause other humans to be held responsible for a certain action
literally: to bear; hence: = action by which humans or deities let go of any anger or resentment with regard to the wrongdoing or sin of (other) humans
literally: to hold; hence: = state in which an object or space is large enough to contain people or objects
literally: to take (someone's) soul/self; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to die
literally: to take (someone's) away; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to die
literally: to hold, carry; hence: = state in which humans are dressed in a piece of clothing; ► used exclusively for the ephod worn by priests; ≈ associated with some level of responsibility as well

literally: to hold, carry; hence: = state in which humans hold something by attaching it to their clothes or by hiding it in the fold of their robes; ≈ often associated with carrying some amount of responsibility for something as well
literally: to hold, carry; hence: = process by which humans undergo certain processes or actions initiated by (other) humans or deities
literally: to take the number (of a group); hence: = action by which humans try to determine the number of a group of people by having them counted
literally: to take the sum (of a group); hence: = action by which humans try to determine the number of a group of people by having them counted
literally: to hold, carry; hence: = action by which humans provide help and support to other humans
literally: to cause to hold, carry; hence: = causative action by which humans take hold of objects and bring them to another location

literally: to cause to hold, carry; hence: = causative action by which humans bring an object to another location by using a means of transportation like an animal, cart, ship, or even one's own shoulder
literally: to bring; hence: = causative action by which humans bring objects to (other) humans or deities as a gift
literally: to hold, carry; hence: = action by which human take possession of something belonging to someone else
literally: to hold, carry; hence: = process by which plants or trees (or the area where they grow) produces branches or fruit
literally: to yield prosperity; hence: = process by which an area produces abundance of crops ► which results in wealth and prosperity
literally: to hold, carry; hence: = state in which humans are willing to listen to other humans
literally: to lift up (one's) face or head); hence: = action by which humans look up without shame
literally: to lift up (one's) hand; hence = action by which humans initiate a physical conflict with other humans
literally: to lift up (one's) head/horn; hence: = action by which nations make an effort to engage in a military conflict with others, usually after having been defeated before but not totally
literally: to lift up (someone's) head; hence: = causative action by which humans declare other humans free after having held them prisoner

literally: to be lifted up = state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
literally: (one's) heart lifts (someone) up; hence: = process by which humans become arrogant in their thinking
literally: to lift up (one's) eyelids; hence: = action by which humans show that they consider themselves to have an elevated status, especially with their eyes
literally: to lift oneself up; hence: = action by which humans, deities, or groups ascribe greatness and authority to themselves
literally: to lift up (someone); hence: = causative action by which humans ascribe greatness and authority to humans, deities, or groups
literally: to arise; hence: = process by which an event starts happening
= action by which an object is lifted or raised into the skies, so that it towers above other objects
literally: to lift up; hence: = causative process by which a certain condition is made less intense
literally: to lift up (one's) foot; hence: = action by which someone starts walking
to lift up (one's eye, face); hence: = action by which humans direct their face or eyes away from the ground so that they can see what is in the distance or in the sky
literally: to lift up (one's) eyes (to); hence: = action by which humans turn to a deity or place with the confidence that they will find help and support there
literally: to lift up (one's) voice = action by which humans speak with a loud voice
literally: to lift up (words); hence: = action by which humans utter certain words
literally: to lift up (one's) wings; hence: = action by which birds or other flying creatures raise their wings in order to fly away
literally: to lift up (one's) hands; hence: = action by which humans raise their arms to receive out, beckon, bless, or pray
= action by which an animal raises itself from a lying position
literally: to lift oneself up; hence: = action by which deities come in action after a time of inactivity

Glosses.Gloss: to lift up oneself = to come into action

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to lift (one's) hand); hence: = action by which deities intervene after a time of inactivity
literally: to lift oneself up; hence: = action by which humans rise up in opposition or armed resistance to their government or ruler
literally: to lift up (one's) hands; hence: = action by which someone takes an oath
literally: to lift up the light (of one's) face (over someone else); hence: = action by which deities show favor to humans ◄ as if the deity causes the light emanating from his face to shine on them

literally: to lift up (someone's) face; hence: = action by which humans or deities show favor or respect to someone, ◄ as if by allowing someone who is looking down out of shame or humility to look up directly into one's face

Glosses.Gloss: to look upon or treat with favor

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: (one's) heart lifts (someone) up; hence: = state in which humans are willing to carry out a specific task
